mods.abstract: Page 116 of the album includes two photographs.; Photograph 1 [42] shows large pots with no growth and numbered tags inside a greenhouse, window frame in the background. [Probable propagation room of Horticulture Hall of the Audubon Park Experiment Station, New Orleans].; Photograph 2 [41] shows rows of maturing seedlings in tiny pots, from the propagation room of Horticulture Hall of the Audubon Park Experiment Station, New Orleans.
mods.note: Compare Photograph 1 to publication link listed below.; Photograph 2 was published in the following journal. Agee, H.P. (1911, May) Sugar Cane Seedlings. Louisiana Bulletin, No. 127, p. 11. Photograph is captioned, "Newly Propagated Seedling Canes." Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://books.google.com/books?id=de42AQAAIAAJ&pg=RA1-PA125&dq=Louisiana+Bulletin+No.+127+1911+Agee&hl=en&sa=X&ei=McrXU9ftF8GNyATt2IK4DQ&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=Louisiana%20Bulletin%20No.%20127%201911%20Agee&f=false; Additional photographs of the Audubon Sugar School may be found digitized in the LDL within the LSU Photograph Collection. Retrieved August 4, 2014, fromhttp://cdm16313.contentdm.oclc.org/cdm/search/collection/LSU_UAP/searchterm/audubon%20sugar%20school/field/all/mode/any/conn/and/order/nosort/ad/asc/cosuppress/1
